name: startFHIRsession
label: Start Session
description: Starts Session with FHIR APIs using SMART Backend Services Authorization

attributes.name: url
attributes.label: URL
attributes.description: https://{hostname}/{instance}/ e.g. for EPIC sandbox https://fhir.epic.com/interconnect-fhir-oauth/

attributes.name: pemFile
attributes.label: Private Key File (.pem)
attributes.description: Private Key file associated with the RSA public key used to register the application with the FHIR server

name: CreatePatient
label: Create Patient
nodeLabel: Create a new patient in FHIR session {{sessionName}}
returnDescription: Returns the FHIR ID in a string

attributes.name: help
attributes.label: Patient Search
attributes.description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization. The Patient.Create web service creates a new patient record or returns an existing one:

- If a single high-threshold match is found in the target environment based on Identity IDs or demographics, the service returns the existing patient.
- If a match is found in external EMPI, the service creates a shell patient in the target environment and returns it.
- If no match is found, the service creates a net new patient in the target environment.

attributes.name: family
attributes.label: Family (Last) Name
attributes.description: The patient's family (last) name.

attributes.name: given
attributes.label: Given Name
attributes.description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

attributes.name: birthdate
attributes.label: Birthdate
attributes.description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

attributes.name: street
attributes.label: Address
attributes.description: The patient's street address.

attributes.name: city
attributes.label: City
attributes.description: The city for patient's home address.

attributes.name: state
attributes.label: State
attributes.description: The state for the patient's home address.

attributes.name: postal
attributes.label: Postal Code
attributes.description: The postal code for patient's home address.

attributes.name: gender
attributes.label: Gender
attributes.description: The patient’s legal sex.

attributes.name: maritalStatus
attributes.label: Marital Status
attributes.description: The patient's marital status. e.g. 'single' or 'married'

attributes.name: phone
attributes.label: Phone
attributes.description: The patient's phone number

attributes.name: email
attributes.label: Email
attributes.description: The patient's email

name: SearchPatient
label: Patient Search
nodeLabel: Search for a patient in FHIR session {{sessionName}}

attributes.name: help
attributes.label: Patient Search
attributes.description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization.

Starting in May 2019, Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record:

- FHIR ID
- {IDType}|{ID}
- SSN identifier
- Given name, family name, and birthdate
- Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

attributes.description: The patient's family (last) name.

attributes.name: given

attributes.name: birthdate

attributes.description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

attributes.name: gender

attributes.description: The patient's phone number or email.
